value.name: Memorial bench honoring Dontre Hamilton at Red Arrow Park approved by Milwaukee County Board
value.description: The Milwaukee County Board of Supervisors approved money to build a memorial for Dontre Hamilton in Red Arrow Park, where he was shot and killed by a Milwaukee police officer in 2014.

value.name: Milwaukee County Board approves funding for Dontre Hamilton memorial bench
value.description: The Milwaukee County Board has approved $3,000 for a memorial bench and plaque in honor of Dontre Hamilton. He was shot and killed by a Milwaukee police officer after being found sleeping in Red Arrow Park on April 30,

value.name: Red Arrow Park Dontre Hamilton memorial funds approved
value.description: The Milwaukee County Board of Supervisors authorized funds Thursday for a Dontre Hamilton memorial at Red Arrow Park.

value.name: Funding of memorial bench at Red Arrow Park for Dontre Hamilton gets Milwaukee County approval
value.description: The County Board of Supervisors adopted [17-1] on May 20, a proposal by Supervisor Sequanna Taylor allocating $3,000 to fund a memorial bench and plaque in Red Arrow Park to honor the life of Dontre Hamilton and lift up the importance of mental health care.

value.name: Supervisor Taylor Secures Funding for Dontre Hamilton Memorial Bench
value.description: The Dontre Hamilton Memorial bench will provide a space of healing for families who have lost loved ones to violence committed by those sworn to protect and serve and bring awareness to mental health issues in our community,

value.name: Protesters, police agree: Not every 911 call needs an officer. Can Milwaukee create a new system?
value.description: Protesters demanded a different option for to 911 calls that does not involve police. A new task force has to figure out what to do — and how.

value.name: Rightly, a memorial will mark Dontre Hamilton’s legacy
value.description: I am pleased by the action of the Milwaukee County Board of Supervisors yesterday as they approved a memorial bench and plaque to be placed in Red Arrow Park honoring the memory of Dontre Hamilton. The Board approved $3,

value.name: Dontre Hamilton police shooting: Family, others rally 7 years later
value.description: MILWAUKEE - Family, friends and faith leaders on April 30 remembered the seventh anniversary of the fatal police shooting of Dontre Hamilton, rallying at Red Arrow Park where he died.

value.name: 'Remember Their Names' rally takes place in Washington Park
value.description: But Sunday in Washington Park in Milwaukee 14 other names were on display with grieving families standing beneath them. They are the names of 14 people killed by police in the Milwaukee area. Ernest Lacy,

video.name: "Remember Their Names" rally at Washington Park

value.name: Post from Community: Supervisor Coggs-Jones statement on one-year anniversary of George Floyd’s murder

value.name: Today Marks One Full Year of Protesting in Milwaukee
value.description: The Milwaukee movement that evolved after the killing of George Floyd hits one year. Protest leaders say this day is not a celebration. It's a call to action.

value.name: ‘Jeffrey Westerfield’ Facebook Post
value.description: Viral posts purportedly describing the death of law enforcement officer Jeffrey Westerfield on his 47th birthday circulated in May 2021, co-opting language of the Black Lives Matter movement.

value.name: America uprising: Scholars reflect on the death of George Floyd. Plus, 10 tips for journalists covering protests against police violence.
value.description: Nearly a dozen scholars on policing, economic and health inequality and media narratives reflect on the death of George Floyd in Minneapolis.
